Detailed Description

Creating and manipulating stereoscopic videos.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvl_dibr_fill_technique_t
 

Chooses how to fill disocclusion holes.

Enumerator:
CVL_DIBR_FILL_NONE  No filling.
CVL_DIBR_FILL_AVG  Use average of the border colors.
CVL_DIBR_FILL_NEAR  Use color of the nearer border.
CVL_DIBR_FILL_FAR  Use color of the farther border.
CVL_DIBR_FILL_LINEAR  Use linear color gradient.

enum cvl_anaglyph_type_t
 

Type of glasses that the anaglyph will be viewed with.

Enumerator:
CVL_ANAGLYPH_RED_CYAN  red/cyan glasses
CVL_ANAGLYPH_RED_GREEN  red/green glasses
CVL_ANAGLYPH_RED_BLUE  red/blue glasses

Function Documentation

cvl_frame_t* cvl_dibr (  const cvl_frame_t *  frame,
const cvl_frame_t *  depthmap,
double  position,
double  zps,
int  b,
double  f,
cvl_dibr_fill_technique_t  fill_technique
) 
 

Parameters:
frame The intermediate view.
depthmap The depth map.
position Position of the intermediate view.
zps Zero parallax setting, should be 0.
b Virtual eye distance in pixels.
f focal length, usually 1.
fill_technique Technique to fill disocclusion holes.
Returns:
A stereoscopic image pair in one frame, left and right view side by side.
Calculate a stereoscopic image pair from an intermediate view and a depth map. The returned frame will contain both the left and right view, side by side. The position parameter refers to the source frame: it must be in [-1,+1], where -1 means left view, +1 means right view, and 0 means intermediate view. zps is the zero parallax setting, it must be in [0,1]. 1 means near, 0 means far. b is the "eye" distance in pixels. f is the camera focal length; usually set to 1.0. Disocclusion holes will be filled with fill_technique.

void cvl_trackdepth_init_first_trackmap (  cvl_field_t *  trackmap,
const cvl_frame_t *  depth
) 
 

Parameters:
trackmap The first trackmap to be initialized.
depth The depth frame for the first trackmap, or NULL if unavailable.
Initializes the first trackmap for one depth tracking direction.

void cvl_trackdepth_init_next_trackmap (  cvl_field_t *  trackmap,
const cvl_field_t *  prev_trackmap,
const cvl_field_t *  flow
) 
 

Parameters:
trackmap The next trackmap to be initialized.
prev_trackmap The previous, already initialized trackmap.
flow The flow in direction from trackmap to prev_trackmap.
Initializes a trackmap for one depth tracking direction.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_trackdepth (  int  N,
int  req,
const cvl_field_t *  trackmap_A,
const cvl_field_t *  trackmap_O
) 
 

Parameters:
N The number of frames for which depth tracking is done.
req The number of the requested depth map, 0 <= req <= N-1.
trackmap_A The trackmap number req for the depth at the first frame.
trackmap_O The trackmap number req for the depth at the last frame.
Returns:
The requested depth map.
Computes a depth map with depth tracking. The complete depth tracking process works as follows:
1. Initialze N trackmaps for depth A (= depth at frame 0) with cvl_trackdepth_init_first_trackmap().
2. Initialze N trackmaps for depth O (= depth at frame N-1) with cvl_trackdepth_init_first_trackmap().
3. Call cvl_trackdepth() for req=0,...,req=N-1.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_anaglyph (  const cvl_frame_t *  stereoframe,
bool  color,
cvl_anaglyph_type_t  type
) 
 

Parameters:
stereoframe Left and right view, side by side.
color Make a full color anaglyph?
type Type of glasses that the anaglyph will be viewed with.
Returns:
The anaglyph frame.
Computes an anaglyph image from a stereo view. Left and right view must have the same dimensions. If color is true, the anaglyph will have full color. This makes only sense when the type is CVL_ANAGLYPH_RED_CYAN. If color is false, the anaglyph will appear monochrome. This works with all types. The anaglyph frame will always be an RGB frame.
